guides_line: Featured in the Michelin Guide, Le Fooding, and Condé Nast Traveller’s Hot List.
horaires:
Open Tuesday to Saturday.
Lunch: Tuesday to Friday, 12:00–1:45 pm.
Dinner: Tuesday to Saturday, 7:30–10:00 pm.
Carte Blanche tasting menu (€55) on Wednesday and Thursday evenings.
footer_guides: Michelin Guide • Le Fooding • Condé Nast Traveller — Hot List 2023
footer_newsletter_subtitle: Seasonal menus and special dinners, by email.
cuisine_p1: Alluma’s cooking follows the rhythm of the seasons and the ingredients available at any given moment. Each dish begins with a product and seeks to express it clearly — sometimes by highlighting lesser-known ingredients, sometimes by revealing a new side of familiar ones.
cuisine_p2: Menus change regularly, with careful attention paid to the full use of ingredients — a natural, pragmatic approach to low-waste cooking. At lunch, a concise menu offers a direct introduction to the cuisine. In the evening, the à la carte selection evolves over time.
cuisine_p3: On Wednesday and Thursday evenings, Alluma offers its Carte Blanche tasting menu (€55), an invitation to experience the chef’s cooking in a focused, midweek format.
cuisine_p4: Vegetarian dishes are an integral part of the menu, alongside fish and meat. Alluma lends itself equally well to an attentive dinner or a more spontaneous visit — to eat, drink, and linger.
wine_p1:
Alluma’s wine list is conceived as a natural extension of the kitchen.
It brings together a selection of independent winemakers, with a strong focus on natural and biodynamic wines, from France as well as Italy, Spain, Greece, Serbia, and Armenia.
wine_p2: Bottles are chosen for their balance, energy, and ability to converse with the food rather than dominate it. The list remains intentionally open yet coherent, favoring living wines meant to be enjoyed at the table, discovered gradually, glass by glass.
story_p1: Alluma opened in late 2022, founded by Noa Gruman Tal and Liran Tal, with the idea of creating a restaurant that reflects their own sensibility — demanding on the plate, yet approachable in the way it is experienced.
story_p2: The name Alluma refers to a beam of light, and to the act of illuminating. A simple idea that has guided the project from the start: to shine light on lesser-known ingredients, or reveal unexpected facets of those we think we know well.
story_p3: This philosophy runs through the entire restaurant. In both the kitchen and the dining room, nothing is designed to impress for its own sake, but rather to spark curiosity, create depth, and invite return visits.
story_p4: Alluma has grown as an open neighborhood table, attentive to its surroundings and to the people who come through its doors. A living restaurant, evolving over time, without losing sight of where it began.
visit_p1:
Alluma is located at 151 rue Saint-Maur, Paris 11, in a lively neighborhood between Parmentier and Goncourt.
The dining room is conceived as a place where one can settle in for a thoughtful dinner or simply stop by to eat and enjoy a glass of wine.
visit_p2:
The restaurant is open for lunch from Wednesday to Friday, and for dinner from Tuesday to Saturday.
Reservations are recommended, particularly in the evening and for the Carte Blanche menu on Wednesdays and Thursdays.
reserve_p1:
Alluma can be experienced in different ways throughout the week, depending on your time and inclination.
For lunch, à la carte dining, or the Carte Blanche tasting menu on Wednesdays and Thursdays, reservations are made directly online.
services_catering_body:
Alluma’s catering service is designed to adapt to a wide range of contexts without losing its identity. It can accompany large private or professional events as well as more intimate gatherings.

Depending on your needs, Alluma offers buffets or plated meals for events of various sizes, as well as formats tailored to large groups. In all cases, the cooking remains seasonal, creative, and rooted in the chef’s work. It is conceived to be clear, balanced, and easy to share, with smooth and reliable organization so that the food integrates naturally into your event.

Delivery can be arranged depending on the format and location. Catering can also take the form of takeaway orders, starting from four guests.
services_form_disclaimer: By submitting this form, you agree to be contacted by email.
services_form_note: Tell us about your project — we’ll get back to you shortly.
services_page_intro: Private events, catering, or a private chef — bespoke formats designed to extend the world of Alluma, adapted to your location, your moment, and your way of hosting.
services_priv_body:
Alluma can be fully privatized for lunches, dinners, corporate gatherings, or personal celebrations in Paris.

Located in the 11th arrondissement, the restaurant offers a warm and adaptable setting, suitable for both refined seated meals and more relaxed formats.

Each private event is built around your needs. Format, pacing, and menu are defined together: seated dinners, tasting menus, shared plates, or simpler configurations. The cooking remains seasonal and guided by a free Mediterranean inspiration, adaptable in both simplicity and level of sophistication.

Privatizing Alluma means gaining access to a flexible space, a chef-driven kitchen — gastronomic or convivial — and attentive support from conception through the day of the event.
services_privatechef_body:
Alluma offers a private chef service in Paris, led by Liran Tal, chef and co-founder of the restaurant. This format allows guests to experience Alluma’s cuisine at home, in an intimate and personalized setting.

The chef comes to your home to cook a private dinner or tasting menu on site. Menus are designed according to the season, your preferences, and the desired level of sophistication. The cuisine can be pared down or more elaborate, while remaining true to Alluma’s spirit and Mediterranean inspiration.

The private chef service allows you to host simply and elegantly, fully enjoying your guests without organizational constraints.
meta_description_menu: À la carte dining and weekday lunch menu — Alluma, Paris 11.
meta_description_services: Private events, catering, and private chef services in Paris — tailored experiences by Alluma.
hero_p1:
Alluma is a neighborhood restaurant in Paris’s 11th arrondissement, built around seasonal cooking and thoughtful gestures.
The menu evolves regularly, shaped by a free and contemporary reading of the Mediterranean — without folklore or excess, guided by precision, balance, and a sense of restraint.
